left:
Columbus has an interlocking set of bicycle rental stations provided by COGO and Zagster. These stations can be seen on this map. COGO stations provide live data about bike and dock availability which we ingest for analysis.

��COGO Stations

Clicking on an orange COGO station will show its current available bikes and docks along with a link to the Google Streetview of the dock location.

��Zagster Stations

Clicking on a blue Zagster dock location will show the Google Streetview of the dock location. Zagster does not provide real time availability for its bikes

Basemaps

Base maps can be switched between grey, topological, and areal imagery by changing the radio button. Some basemaps have more detail and can be zoomed in further than others.
right:
��COGO DATA

COGO Station Data courtesy of COGO Bikeshare. Download a geoJSON file of the current status of the stations.

��ZAGSTER DATA

Zagster Station Data courtesy of Zagster Bikeshare Download a geoJSON file of their locations.

BASEMAPS

Basemaps are provided by Esri and hosted on ArcGIS online. Basemaps can be integrated into webmaps for free.

left:
This map displays the air quality reported by monitoring stations across Ohio. Stations monitor PM2.5, Ozone, or both. The air quality index is categorized using standards set by the U.S. EPA. Fossil fueled power plants are also show as they have an effect on air quality.

Air Quality Stations

Clicking on an air quality station will zoom to that station and display information for that station. Air quality stations are symbolized by their reading status. See the legend for an explanation of the air quality status.

Electric Power Plants

Clicking on a power plant will bring up information about that plant.
right:
Air Quality Data

Air quality data is collected by monitors in the field and reported to the Ohio EPA.

Download the current readings as a geoJSON file

Power Plants

Power plant station data is provided by the U.S. Energy Information Administration.

Download a shape file of their locations

Basemaps

Basemaps are provided by Esri and hosted on ArcGIS online. Basemaps can be integrated into webmaps for free.

left: This map shows housing characteristics by census tract in the Mid-Ohio Regional Planning Commission (MORPC) planning area. This is an interactive map, which means when clicking on the map, the information will be presented by popup.
right:
MORPC PLANNING AREA HOUSING DATA

MAP TEMPLATE

This map is based on a bootleaf template created by Brian McBride

left: This map visualizes COTA stops by total riders at that stop. The data are from May to August 2014. The map shows the top 1000 stops by ridership. Multiple stops may exist at the same locations but for different bus lines. Clicking on a station brings up a window with more information about that station including a Google Streetview image of the station area. Clicking the Google Streetview link will open a new window at Google and allow you to move around the station area.
right:
COTA Data

COTA publishes their stops and routes in several formats. They also have a streaming feed of live bus location data. Data can be downloaded at the COTA Website.

left:
This map shows several themes of water in central Ohio. It has the HUC-8 watersheds associated with Ohio, NDPES permits holders, and combined sewer locations. The inital map extent shows the lines of flow for water overlaid over an Esri topological map. Zooming out removes the watershed and stream flow layers.

HUC-8 Watersheds and Stream Flow Lines

Watersheds of the National Watershed Boundary Dataset are defined by their hydraulic unit code (HUC). The smaller the number the larger the area covered.

CSO Locations

Combined sewer overflows are locations where the sanitary sewer and storm sewer may overflow into rivers and streams releasing polluted water.

NPDES Permits

The National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) regulates the dumping of waste into waterways. This layer shows locations where permits to dump waste are located.

Basemaps

Basemaps are provided by Esri and hosted on ArcGIS online. Basemaps can be integrated into webmaps for free.
right:
Watershed Data

Watershed data are from the USGS. This layer is displayed using a tile service on our GIS server.

CSO Location Data

CSO location data is served by the City of Columbus GIS Servers

Basemaps

Basemaps are provided by Esri and hosted on ArcGIS online. Basemaps can be integrated into webmaps for free.

left:
This map displays the places where combined sewer overflows (CSO) and sanitary sewer overflow

CSO Locations

Combined sewer overflows are locations where the storm sewer may overflow into rivers and streams releasing polluted water.

SSO Locations

Sanitary sewer overflows are locations where the sanitary sewer may overflow into rivers and streams releasing polluted water.

CSO/SSO Locations

Combined CSO/SSO overflows are locations where the sanitary sewer and storm sewer may overflow into rivers and streams releasing polluted water.
right:
CSO/SSO Data

CSO/SSO data are hosted on the GIS server of the City of Columbus. at the City of Columbus open data site. This link returns a JSON object containing all of the SO locations

left:
This map shows ethnic demographic data by block group for Franklin County. The data come from the U.S. Census Bureau. The histogram and the the map are linked. Click in the drop down box to select a U.S. Census designated ethnicity and the map will update. Hovering over a bin in the histogram will show those block groups on the map.

U.S. Census Data

U.S. Census Data are available at the U.S. Census American Factfinder website.

Basemaps

Basemaps can be selected from the map control in the upper right corner.
right: Census data are from the U.S. Census. Download a geoJSON file

left:
BIKE GREENWAYS

Bike greenways are dedicated paths for fitness activites.

BIKE TRAIL HEADS

Trail heads allow access to greenways. Most have parking and park facilities at them.

ROUTES BY LEVEL OF COMFORT

These are streets rated by the level of comfort of bicycle riders
right:
BIKE DATA

Trail and Street data come from MORPC.>

left:
This map displays NPDES permit holders in Ohio and the locations of drinking water inlets. The National Pollution Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) is a pollution regulation system to decrease point water pollution sources.

Drinking Water Inlets

These icons show the locations of drinking water inlets.

Permit Holders

These icons show the locations of NPDES permit holders.

1 Mile Inlet Buffers

These icons show 1 mile rings around the drinking water inlets.
right:
NPDES Data

NPDES data are served by the Ohio EPA. Gas Buddy.

Download the current gas price data.

left:
This map displays the 10 highest and 10 lowest prices for gas in Franklin county. Prices are from Gas Buddy. The prices are sampled in the morning and evening.

Gas Stations

Gas stations are shown ranked by price. Clicking on a gas station will give more information about that station. The 10 lowest priced stations are ranked and numbered on each pushpin. The red pins are the 10 highest stations.
right:
Gas price data are collected Gas Buddy.

Download the current gas price data.

left:
This is a map of the trees maintained by the City of Columbus.. This database has the locations along with various characteristics of the trees like condition, age, etc. Try changing the basemap to imagery or topographic at tighter zoom to see exactly where the largest trees are.

 TREES

Circles represent trees that are in the City of Columbus tree management system. The size of the circle represents the diameter of the trunk at 4.5 feet from the ground also known as diameter at breast height (DBH). Larger trees are shaded orange to make them stand out.
right:
TREE DATA

Columbus Tree Data courtesy of the City of Columbus. Download the tree data at the City of Columbus open data site.
